item.description: So, I finally got this working with two client VPN tun devices and its balancing nicely with all the traffic...until one of the remote VPN servers goes down. What kernel is your device running? It could still be caching the routes. Also have a ip route show, and see what the default is. If it's not shown check ip rule and then check those tables too.

item.title: By: Ira
item.dc:creator: Ira
item.description: Up for a challenge? I set this up in OpenVPN client using Tun(s) instead of physical eth ports. I have tun0, tun1, tun2 for three simultaneous connections to three different VPN servers. And everything connects and works - except the weighted routing. My Pings out the different interfaces work: ping -I tun0 8.8.8.8 ping -I tun1 8.8.8.8 ping -I tun2 8.8.8.8 And ifconfig shows packets sent and received over each of the tuns, but tun1 is always being used as the default even though I've give tun0 a weight of 3, tun1 weight 2, and tun3 weight1. I think this is because of either router caching or tun1 always connects first. But if I try to look at the router cache, it shows nothing (ip route show cache). It will, on very rare occasions, switch to another tun, but it often switches to tun2 (with the lowest weight) even though tun0 is up, working, and has the heighest weight. Any ideas what I might be doing wrong? Where I can look for clues? Thanks! And great article! I'm like 90% there with this!!
item.content:encoded:
Up for a challenge?
I set this up in OpenVPN client using Tun(s) instead of physical eth ports. I have tun0, tun1, tun2 for three simultaneous connections to three different VPN servers. And everything connects and works – except the weighted routing.
My Pings out the different interfaces work:
ping -I tun0 8.8.8.8
ping -I tun1 8.8.8.8
ping -I tun2 8.8.8.8
And ifconfig shows packets sent and received over each of the tuns, but tun1 is always being used as the default even though I’ve give tun0 a weight of 3, tun1 weight 2, and tun3 weight1.
I think this is because of either router caching or tun1 always connects first.
But if I try to look at the router cache, it shows nothing (ip route show cache).
It will, on very rare occasions, switch to another tun, but it often switches to tun2 (with the lowest weight) even though tun0 is up, working, and has the heighest weight.
Any ideas what I might be doing wrong? Where I can look for clues?
Thanks! And great article! I’m like 90% there with this!!

I achieved this using multi path routing and documented the solution here: Over Engineering FTW. […]
